main event: On 21 July 1953, observers in Creola, Alabama, reported sightings of unidentified flying objects: one appeared bright and elliptical, moving rapidly and disappearing below the horizon, while another was described as a bright reddish glow traveling at high speed.
interesting points: The sightings were reported under clear weather conditions with no other aircraft or celestial objects observed nearby., The bright white object was observed for approximately 30 seconds before disappearing., Witnesses noted the elongated shape of the first object and the rapid motion of the reddish light., The sightings were deemed to lack any associated sounds, reinforcing their unidentified nature., There were multiple reports and investigations conducted by U.S. Air Force personnel, highlighting their interest in the Creola area during this time.
sighted object: a bright white elliptical object and a bright reddish glow
